Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ilustre g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sta Lucia train station is a short distance away. There are many food shops when you go outside the hotel. There is no elevator going to the front desk so you have to carry your luggage up the stairs--they have an elevator from that level upwards. The toilet in our room was small, kind of modular. Taking a shower wets the whole toilet floor despite the shower curtain. The staff in the front desk is not very pleasant though they are helpful. The kitchen staff are ok

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: El G
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: Hotel Nazionale is an above average hotel. It is well situated in the center of all tourist attractions in Venice. The street immediate of the hotel offers plenty of restaurant and shopping opportunities right at your doorstep. The hotel is conveniently located a block away from the Venice-Mestre railway station. This hotel has a lot of potential in all aspects. Weâ€™ll definitely stay here again. TRAVEL DATES: September-2009 LOCATION: Centrally located. POSITIVE NOTES: Great location; Above average accommodations; Friendly staff. NEGATIVE NOTES: The rooms located up front can be somewhat noisy due to nearby restaurants and pedestrian traffic; No in-room safe to store our passports. AMENITIES: Free breakfast, Wi-Fi Access (surcharge apply); Coffee Maker, Hairdryer, Clock/Radio. NIGHTLY RATE: $175+ DISCOUNT ACCEPTED: None. Booked via Travelocity for a slightly lower price. NOTES: Please click the green â€œYESâ€� button below if you find this review helpful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “nice place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: boris_sto
Reviews.Content: Hotel situted close to train station. Rooms ar small and dark. Beds are comfortable. Hotel is clean and staff are very plesant. Receptionists speak dirrerent languages (not only Italian and English). Breakfast is fine with lots of dishes. Good value for money - one of the cheapest hotels in Venice with private bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Cramped”
Reviews.Author: W P
Reviews.Content: Navigating the stairways, hallways and rooms of this hotel is like navigating a rabbit warren! The rooms are small and dark. I think the rooms were generally clean but that could be debatable. The staff was ok, Stefano in particular was very nice and gave some restaurant recommendations. The hotel is very outdated (wall-to-wall carpet and fabric covered walls in the rooms) which contributes the appearance that the it is less than clean. I will say that cleaning staff carried lots of bug spray on the carts and routinely used it in the rooms so that was enough to make me nervous! All in all, it was ok I have definitely stayed in better hotels and, unfortunately, I've stayed in worse. I wouldn't recommend this hotel but if you're in a pinch and you need somewhere to stay for a night or two it will probably do...

Reviews.Title: “If you like stairs . . .”
Reviews.Author: David-FW
Reviews.Content: Had to close bathroom door to see TV, bathroom door only opened halfway as it hit bed. The pics of bathrooms on this website were not any from our group! We had dingy shower curtains; bathrooms were as small or smaller than on a cruise ship. I had to walk a long way, up, down, around--about 25 stairs to my room in "lower level."

Reviews.Title: “grumpy reception staff”
Reviews.Author: annquietly
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean but decor very outdated. Breakfast basic but adequet. On arriving at this hotel we found the two ladies at reception were unfriendly, uninterested in their work, impatient and rude. This was not the case with the night receptionist who was friendly and smiling while he greeted us. They really could do better in welcoming their guests. I would suggest that you try booking other hotels, leaving this one at the end of your list.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, affordable and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Lenla
Reviews.Content: A fairly basic hotel with slightly dated decor but less than 5 minutes away from the Grand Canal, a vaparetto stop, railway station and just a little further to a bus station (useful for getting to the airport at awkward hours). The hotel overall could do with updating but everything we saw was clean and in good repair. The breakfasts were rather basic and only ran from 8-10 (so not totally ideal for early birds who want to be up and out to see Venice) but it was ideal for a quick bite to eat. The reception staff were on the whole polite but some seemed a little curt. Cleaners and waitresses always greeted customers warmly. Previouos posters have commented about keys being on display at reception, I don't think this was a major issue as reception is not at street level and was always manned whenever we passed. I would probably stay here again due mainly to the excellent location and price the only deterrent would be the slightly outdated decoration but I feel this is a minor point to the what is otherwise a very convenient, affordable and well situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Station, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SKrishnan2011
Reviews.Content: Family with Teenage children who are always hungry, and raring to go. So this place was fantastic, a three minute walk from the station we basically dragged our bags from the train station to the hotel and found it in minutes. Its surrounded by eateries. The pizza place underneath the hotel can give you internet access easily, which was great when we wanted to check up on things.. However we had to take the vaporatto to the main sights which costed us a bit. But nevertheless, as we stayed only for two days it was a great way to see Venice.. and Murano Island..

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with location”
Reviews.Author: theAndersens
Reviews.Content: We are a family of husband and wife and a 9 year old girl. We went to Venice in July 2011 and booked 2 nights at Hotel Nazionale. We were very pleased with the hotelÂ´s excellent location. For tourists, this hotel is perfect as it sits right on the Â´walking streetÂ´ where there are loads of restaurant and shops. Although our room was not bright enough (with only one window), we were happy with the bathroom which has a window that lends brightness and airiness into the bedroom. The bathroom is new and we were given sufficient towels and toiletries without having to ask for more. The restaurant serves a good morning breakfast with ample warm breads, coffee, a selection of meat slices and fruits. The hotel looked a little bit like Fawlty Towers! If we go to Venice again, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,average hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLM22
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Venice with a friend,just for a couple of days,so we could visit Biennale.The bus we travelled on came to Venice very early,at 2am,and we went to the hotel,hoping we could leave our bags there,but it was locked,so we had to wander around Venice,which was empty and creepy,until about 5 am when we tried again.There was a man on the reception,who previously fell asleep,and told us we could leave our bags and come back later. Fortunately,we managed to check in at 10am,because we were very tired and we explained it to them. At first,the staff was kind of rude,but they became nice later. There was a bell boy who was very nice and carried our bags to our room. Rooms are relatively small.We had twin beds,a closet with a safe and a small desk,but there was just enough space for the two of us.Room had an air-conditioning system which we could adjust ourselves. Bathroom was TINY.You have all you need there,but everything is cramped. The rooms are cleaned every day.They also bring you fresh towels and make up the beds. We had a breakfast service.It was ok,nothing special.Continental breakfast buffet with a modest offer. The location is great and you can move around the city easily.It is located next to Venice St.Lucia train station.There is a supermarket where you can find cheap food within 5 mins walking distance. We would definitely come back,since the service is good,and the location is great for that value.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked at how nice for the price we paid!”
Reviews.Author: j0y2thew0rld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this honeymoon 6 months in advance so we got a great price for high tourist season in July. I thought it would be a whole in the wall hotel but it was great. The manager impressed us immediately and knew English very well. He actually knew lots of languages as we saw him talk to several people. You have to leave your key at the desk everytime you leave the hotel. I didn't like that at first but since the key has a very heavy magnet on it, I didn't mind leaving it behind. The breakfast every morning was always fresh and well stocked. The workers were always busy refilling and cooking. It was really tasty as well. They had cereals, yoghurt, toast, warm croissants, ham, cheese, and coffee and tea. It was a great atmosphere as well. You look out from the 2nd floor onto a beautiful green garden. The caddie helped us the 1st day lug our luggage up the 4 flights of stairs to our room because the lift has only room enough for 2 human bodies to stand (LITERALLY). The room was spacious and always cool. They bathroom clean and always stocked every day. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not my style!”
Reviews.Author: uptightoutasight
Reviews.Content: My initial reaction was trepidation. Got used to it after a while! Pros. Close to station. Good location. The important things are clean. Fine if you are using it as a base and spending little time actually in the room. Cons. Security! I could have looked at the keys picked a number and gone into a room. Keys in pigeonholes mean you are out. Stairs. Grimy appearance Tiny rooms and no space to put anything much. Labrynth that was probably a fire trap. Wi Fi in lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location”
Reviews.Author: squirrelgal
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here because the B&B I originally booked with had to cancel unexpectedly at the last minute. Luckily I managed to haggle getting the room in hotel nazionale at the same price as my original booking (but not with the hotel itself). So I paid about half the price they would normally charge. I really feel that you pay for the location only... the room itself was very small and the bathroom was tiny. I'm really not normally one to complain about this sort of thing, but the shower was so small that shaving my legs felt like an extreme sport. It's literally only about shoulder width wide in all directions, and I'm quite a small person! It's only a couple of minutes from the main train station and bus station, so no dragging suitcases around a lot of bridges. And it meant that I didn't get very lost, because when heading back in the evenings I just had to follow all the numerous signs to the train station! I was worried that being next to a train station would mean the area was shaddy, but it wasn't the case at all. I felt safe there as a female traveler on my own. However while the location is good because it's on the main island... it's also a decent walk from the main tourist areas: ~30mins to rialto bridge, ~40mins to st. marks square. If I could stay here again for the same price I would, but I doubt they'd lower their prices that much and would probably choose to go with what I had originally booked instead, which was also on the main island. I think at the prices they charge they should at least throw in free wifi. I didn't bother paying extra for this! If you really want to stay on the main island my advice would be to shop around for somewhere cheaper, because there are a few.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY there”
Reviews.Author: LoKo00
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to experiencing Venice, and like many other reviews, this hotel stay destroyed my memory of Venice Where to begin, upon arrival these were the observations: -Less than congenial/helpfull staff -Many flights of stairs (not handicap friendly) -The room we were provided was in the lowest & farthest part of the hotel from the front door (we were basically 1/2 flight of stairs from being in the basement). We had to go up or down a total of 5 sets of stairs& 6 hallways each time to/from our room, with no emergency exit in between. The hotel was dark and dingy (it was like an episode of The Shiining), all kidding aside, I was actually afraid, that if there was a fire we would have never been able to navigate our way out of there-very hazardous -Place smells like a urinal in an mens bathroom of an all night bar. The place had the appearance of being clean, but smelt, looked and felt dingy & crudy. -Bathrooms exceptionally small (with septic drain in floor-adding the the urine aroma) -Rooms exceptionally small (barely room for bed), which meant luggage was something you had to step over each time you walked to/from the bathroom or entrance -Can hear noise from adjoining rooms & hallways -Barking dog, that had access to the hotel basement and garden (which our window opened to) -Constant incovenience of giving up the room key when leaving the hotel (for what reason I do not know). When picking up the key, they never asked for ID to validate that were were the registered guests of that room -They advertise "Wi-Fi access", truth is Wi-fi is only available in the hotel lobby (which has NO privacy) and costs $9 Euro each time you use it. Overally I would be hard pressed to rate this hotel a 1/2 star let alone 4 (even with its convenient location). Without a doubt, Hotel Nazionale is the worst Hotel I have every had the displeasure of experiencing (and I travel alot). Had we not prepaid for the room thru a booking agent (Hotwire), I would have walked out of that place-the place should be condemned. Do not be fooled by the photos on line, they are not an accurate representation of how poor this hotel actually is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Andy-D-O
Reviews.Content: As per the other reviews, the bathroom is ridiculous, even for Europe. 3 ft x 4 ft, with a toilet, bidet, sink, and sticky shower curtains. The room seemed clean, but now I have developed a rash which may be ringworm. Location is great, value is great . One odd thing is that the front desk firmly demands that you leave your keys with them when you leave and pick them up when you return. When you pick them up you do nothing to confirm your identity, so anyone off the street could access your room. The staff then use the keys to turn off the air conditioner and open your window to the heat and mosquitoes, and every night we had to battle the bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: D_Nicole85
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Venice and I was hoping to stay at Hotel Canal Grande, which was an excellent hotel I stayed at the first time. Unfortunately, it was sold out, so I made a quest to find another hotel near the train/bus stations. This hotel was located in the perfect spot. We took the train from Rome to Venice, and this hotel was literally a two minute walk from the train station. At 6AM, the sign was lit up and this hotel was super easy to find. Although the surrounding hotels in the area had elevators and were fancier (and probably enormously expensive), this hotel had a dozen stairs to get to the lobby, and several more staircases to get to your room. Breakfast was included in the room, but we missed it both days we were there - once too late, once too early. This hotel is also on the walking route to the main sites; the perfect walk for shopping, eating, and photos. Overall, if you're on a tight budget and you need a place to stay for a couple of days near the train/bus stations, then this is the perfect hotel. It's simple and basic, definitely not a Venetian gem, but at the price they offer, the location can't be beat! However, if you're staying 3+ days, then I would probably spring for a hotel with more room, comfort, and less stairs.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a few nights!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine818
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nazionale was in a great location -- it's within a short walking distance to the Santa Lucia train station, and a 1 stop vaporetti ride from Piazzale Roma (bus station). Our bus dropped us off at the station, and instead of taking the vaporetto over to the Ferrovia, which is the closest stop to the hotel, we walked it. It took a few minutes, and was hard since we had luggage and had to go over the bridge with all those steps.. but we managed to make it just fine. The hotel is situated between 2 restaurants, and is easy to find. There's a big neon sign overhead as well. In order to get to the hotel lobby, you have a long staircase that you have to climb which is hard when you have large, heavy luggage like we did. It's about 30 or so steps up. The staff was friendly at times, and short sometimes, depending on who was at the front desk. They all spoke English. They have a kind gentleman who helped us to our room with our luggage. We stayed on the 2nd floor in a double room. The room was fairly small, almost all bed, but there was enough room for both our large luggage and some space to still walk around. There's a closet and a safe inside it. There's was a TV, a hairdryer in the bathroom, and you have to pay for internet access if you bring your laptop. Only soap and shampoo was given. The restroom was very small. I could sit on the toilet, and lean my arm on the sink. There's a bidet and a very, very small area for the shower. The shower curtain, if not careful will stick to your body when showering, and it's easy to get the entire bathroom all wet when taking a shower because it's just a shower curtain. No wonder they have a cover over the toilet paper! It wasn't that bad, it's doable, just small. The room was quiet, and we were able to get a good night's sleep from all the walking and vaporetti rides around Venice. We experienced no noise in the corridors or next to us. Breakfast was OK - bread, pastries, ham, cheese, juices, cereal, yogurt. Breakfast was until 10am. We took a lot of vaporetti #2 - the express one as well as the night bus. #1 stops at all stops and is the slower one. Make sure to buy a pass depending on how long you'll be there! We bought a 36 hour pass and used it a lot to get everywhere. Overall, an average stay for our 2 nights in Venice. Location is what made it convenient for us. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money,great location”
Reviews.Author: vr2011
Reviews.Content: arrived at Treviso airport,express bus just outside door took us to within 5 min walk of hotel.Hotel decor in room very gaudy with red stripped walls and red carpet.Bed hard so didnt sleep well but very clean and for the time spent in room it was all we needed.On a busy street with lots of atmosphere but all rooms quiet.Good breakfast.Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten to death, stay away”
Reviews.Author: decodbs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in venice, The hotel has a great location, but that is all that goes for it, even breakfast was mediocre. After night one i noticed a few spots on my body but thought nothing of them. after we lft the second day i was covered from head to toe with spots and itching all week after it. I got eaten by bed bugs. Three weeks on im not still fully recovered The hotel is not cleaned on a daily basis and honestly i can only say location isnt everything and choose a new hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Grabboo
Reviews.Content: Our choir (approx. 38 people) stopped in Venice for two nights. This hotel is conveniently located close to the train station and the major tourist bus drop-off point in Venice (Piazzale Roma). The rooms were clean, if a bit small (this is something to be expected in Venice). The air conditioning was not working when we arrived, but they had fixed it by the next day (thankfully, as it was 38+ degrees during our stay). The breakfast was good, and the staff was very accomodating to our group's requests and helped us booked evening meals and even helped us hire a boat to transport our group to and from Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: werk4travel
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel Nazionale in Venice very last minute, based mainly on the reviews. As usual I ignored the worst reviews and concentrated on the aspects I required for our stay in Venice, mainly proximity to the train station as we had train passes and planned on lots of early mornings and late returns. Two minute walk to the train station and very easy to find when you first arrive dazed from an overnight flight. Staff was fine, don't really bother much about them anyway. Small rooms, and tiny bathrooms, but clean and all we needed. Breakfast the usual breads, cereals etc., but no fruit which we thought was odd. The beds were really firm and I had to put the extra blankets on the mattress to soften it up for my bad back, but was fine. The main reason to stay there was the location. It is really easy to get lost in Venice, and if you need to get to the train early you can eat breakfast and stroll to the train station in plenty of time. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing..”
Reviews.Author: MitchamboyManty
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was mediocre, the (twin) room we had on the third floor was dark and musty and the bathroom was tiny even by Italian standards. Staff gave the impression they didn't really like what they were doing, and there seemed to be an odd smell lingering on the stairway, one of those cats responsible, maybe? And, can you believe it, this 'hotel' only has ONE hair dryer, which is kept in a drawer at reception, and for which you will have to pay a 10 euro deposit, that's if the previous hirer has returned it! Didn't really worry me as I'm bald as a coot. Follically challenged the missus says. On the plus side, the air con worked OK, and the bed was fairly comfy. Location good too. But only 300 big ones for 2 nights with 'breakfast' in a place like Venice? You decide...

Reviews.Title: “Enough space for one very small for two...”
Reviews.Author: Jorch67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in nearby Santa Lucia railway station (and all it's services like Ferrovia vaporetto station) and Piazzale Roma bus station and it's very easy to approach from Marco Polo airport by bus or Alilaguna's boat (from airport to Guglie vaporetto station) wich I personally recommed warmly!! Hotel entrance was intresting: Small door between two restaurants and stairs straight to second floor (if you have bad legs!!!) The receptionist was grumpy (but efficient) and piccolo took to the room and show it to me (tipping reccomended!! Piccolo guy was also cleaning personel in next morning) I had room 452 from 4th floor (top floor) which wasn't the smallest room around but for twin room it was really small. There was 140cm wide bed, closet for jackets & shoes, small table and small module toilet/bidee/shower unit. Two large suitcases does not fit into room open at same time! I had problem while fitting umbrella and cabin luggage there! Breakfast was nothing special (cereal/myesli/coffe/tea/youghurt/white bread/croisant) but while it was included the room price it was ok.. Summa summarum: Small rooms in good location for quite ok price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: WarwickShep2
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find, over the bridge from the bus station and 2 minute walk, very easy late at night. Good reception, yes a lot of staris but fortunatly that is not a problem for us. Good clean rooms, if a liitle cold. Fantastic location, this is what we went for. breakfast ok, coffe is different, but I got used to it. This hotel will not be beaten for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Friendly & Helpfull Staff, Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tobias_Rags
Reviews.Content: The location was Ideal inbetween all the shops, train station. Boat station. Get the coach from Marco Polo Airport, which costs â‚¬3,00. The stop is located between the Arrivals terminal and the Departures area.You can buy tickets from ATVO counter in arrivals.Rooms are small but i didnt care as i was there to sight see and not stay in my room. Breakfast is the best part of the hotel..! Venice is expensive city, take a boat bus ride not taxi though as they are very expensive to have the best view along the grand canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Salume
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the best you can get in terms of location in Venice. Very, very close to the train station. The room is small, but this didnÂ´t matter. It has an excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rude staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gavna9
Reviews.Content: Depending upon what you are looking for from your holiday should depend on whether you stay here! If you are looking for location location location, as well as value for money then Hotel Nazionale is fine for what you are looking for. It is very close to the train and bus station, which means great access from the airport. Everything else on Venice is within walking distance. However, I have never stayed at a hotel where the staff have been quite so rude. They said in total three words to myself and my boyfriend, in our 5 day stay there. It was almost as if conversation and manners was out of the question. Breakfast is very very basic, but as expected for price. Rooms and bathrooms are very very small. On the whole a basic place with miserable staff but great location. Take a day trip to Lido if you get chance to, lovely place!!

Reviews.Title: “Average place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: megadayan
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty old. Toilet VERY small. Lots of stairs to get to the reception. Apart from that it was a good experience. For Venice standards the price is good and location very good. Close to train and ferry stations. Lots of places to eat...

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF MOANERS!!”
Reviews.Author: xyz91
Reviews.Content: I don't know why some people complain about this hotel. You can't pay average rates and expect Hilton or the Ritz standard. Just returned to London after a few days there. We found it perfectly adequate - the good location, cleanliness, good breakfast and yes, a friendly service. Perhaps not all of them were proficient in English, but we were trying our best Italian which was very appreciated. We politely asked for extra stuff and we got it with no problem. We politely asked for advice and got it. So maybe being polite is the name of the game.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Try the Hotel Bellini down the street.”
Reviews.Author: Kellermeyer
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel and that is it. It is right outside of the train station and we were feeling smug about not having to schlep our bags and two small children up and down the steps of the city. And then we saw the steps to the lobby. It was at least two stories up. No biggie. If our problems stopped there, I would have given this a higher rating. There are permanent residents here and they have a cat that they let wander the hallways. The hallways smell like cat pee. People with allergies beware! The rooms were small, but managable. We had a triple which was a double bed and a single bed on the second floor. They advertise air conditioning, though there was none. There was a unit in our room that blew air, but not below 80F. Seriously. The hall was cooler. The staff was rude. They tried to tell me the air conditioning was b/c Europeans do not value cool air. The they said I had to be patient. (We left it on while we toured for hours.) They refused to change my room. They allegedly sent in a technician when we were out and we were informed that it was working. (Clearly I have never felt cool air before.) We were exhausted and stayed for one night of our three night reservation. Even reception the next morning was rude. We checked out and found a glorious room at the Hotel Bellini, even closer to the train staition with air conditioning and a friendly, multilingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ontariomissus
Reviews.Content: 35 steps up to the lobby from the street level, we found the reception nicely air conditioned. The lobby was average, but comfortable. We were assigned a room on the 1st floor, through hallways and stairs. Our room was undescribably small. We have been all over Italy and this was so small, there was no room for suitcases. My husband had to throw the suitcase on top of the wardrobe so we would have room to walk. The walls were covered with material that was stained with dead mosquitos. The bathroom--I have never been in a bathroom that small. My knees touched the wall from the toilet and the shower cubicle didn't even have a soap dish. That was the good part. Apparently, the air conditioner only worked in the front lobby. The air conditioner did not work and when our group complained, reception said they would see what they could do. Apparently nothing. The fan was on, throwing out damp air making the room damp right through to the bedding. The windows could not be opened because of the clouds of mosquitos. Breakfast was adequate with meat, cheese, yoghurt, cereal and fresh baked croissants. However, the coffee was the worst in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: sangwithchoir
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a tour group. I was very nervous after reading the other reviews! The rooms were very small indeed, but if you can ask for room 101 it is right by the lobby and has (by comparison) a palatial bathroom with a wonderful shower!! All new and clean and apparently very large compared to the rest of the rooms people in our tour got. The breakfast was ok, ham and cheese and croissants and rolls, cereal, yogurts, etc, but the trick concerning the undrinkable coffee on offer is to order a cappaccino, which will be brought to you and is excellent! I only realised that on the 3rd morning and wish I had done it each morning! They will also make hot chocolate for the kids. The hotel was in great location, near the railway station and also near a canal bus stop, very useful. I felt reasonably safe there but always make sure to put your passports in your safe in the closet because some members of our group had their passports go missing. Venice is lovely and we had good weather and a great time.

Reviews.Title: “I was very surprised.....”
Reviews.Author: filo02
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a hotel in a dark alley with no type of customer service and a long walk to get to the tourist areas. Boy was I surprised!!!.....the hotel is just 5 min from the train station Santa Lucia. You can actually see the hotel from the front of the train station. It is on the street front surrounded by many types of business on a quite busy tourist street. I noticed that there had not been a review of this hotel since the beginning of this year and I was quite nervous from what I had read from the previous reviews. But the hotel itself is very nice and clean. The breakfast is very good and the service is average. The room was larger than what we were expecting and the bathroom also. In conclusion, dont believe the previous reviews and give this hotel a try if you to book early in advance. It can be quite expensive if booked late.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one”
Reviews.Author: dizydotz
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel with 8 couples. Each couple had very depressing rooms. The bathrooms in some of the couples rooms were a shower, toilet, sink and bedet all in one with just a shower curtain separating the shower from the rest of the bathroom. The rooms were dark and dreary with misquito blood on the walls and stained carpeting. The hallway to the rooms is dark and dreary also. One person was handicaped and had to climb up the flight of stairs to get to the lobby. There is no elevator on the ground level. The staff is very rude especially the elderly gentleman at the front desk that is always annoyed. Breakfast is only croissants, coffee, juice. This was a terrible experience for beautiful Venice. Definitely upgrade to a 4 star hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hotel Nazionale, Venice”
Reviews.Author: CambaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: A solo female traveller in her fifties who stayed in this hotel in September, I found the room adequate though like other reviewers felt Venice in its own class for pricing. However, the real problem with the room was poor ventilation and it stank of cigarette smoke which the cleaners were unable to rectify. The material texture wallpaper probably made it impossible to rid of the smell. As a non smoker this caused me some distress and a headache but had paid in advance and not able to move on. I come from New Zealand where the smoking regulations are tighter than I observed in Europe so smoking may be a cultural issue. The lack of assistance with luggage was also unhelpful. On the positive side I note some reviewers complained re breakfast, but when I was there, there was a good range of cereal, bread, croissants and boiled eggs on a 'much as you want' basis so I felt that aspect good value. It is also convenient for the train and bus stations/exiting Venice and on a sufficiently busy but not noisy street to feel very safe even in the early hours. All linen was clean and the bed made daily.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nazionale isn't fancy, but it's a good value. The room was small, basic, clean and comfortable, staff was friendly enough and the hotel is in a good location. The street it's on is very touristy and crowded, but walk just a few minutes north and it's much more pleasant; less crowded, fewer tourists, and better restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “As budget as it can be!”
Reviews.Author: LoneJetsetter
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Venice. I stayed in Hotel Nazionale for 2 nights and 3 days. POSITIVES: o LOCATION - it is near the bus station (Piazzale Roma), train station (Stazione Sta. Lucia), vaporetto stop (Ferrovia stop). It is on a quite busy street, so even during early mornings there are people and shops open. This is good for single travellers. o STAFF - the staff is very friendly. They can speak english, but they are patient enough if you want to try your Italian. I tried asking questions about where things are and they are helpful enough. o ROOM - I go the single bed room. I found everything I needed in it, but it is really basic as it can get. I was a bit shocked by the size of the room, but in the end I've accepted it as it is budget as budget goes. It was comfortable anyway. There were a number of channels availabe on TV most of it were Italian channels. There were 1 or 2 channels in English. o SECURITY - unlike other hotels I've tried around the world, I found that Hotel Nazionale is quite safe. I did not lose anything. My things were not touched when I was away. NEGATIVES: o NO AIRCON - I went when it was a bit cool during the night. There were mosquitoes coming inside my room, so had to close the windows. I tried turning on the airconditioning, but hot air was blowing out of the unit. The receptionist said that it is a central control in the whole building, they have not switched onto cold air yet. I forgot to bring my bug repellant, so woke up with a few bites. o BATHROOM/TOILET STINKS - every time I go to the bathroom, it smelled like stale cigarette smoke and unclean toilet seat. I don't know where it was coming from. Maybe from the canal water, I dont know, but it really bothered me. o THIN ROOM WALLS - it was too thin. I was awakened a number of times by the adjoining room. They were really noisy, but I realised they were having a normal conversation (they did laugh a bit loud though). I would still go to Hotel Nazionale the next time, because: - Now I know what to expect - Cheaper than most - Location
